intro: Cytisus baeticus var. extravagans, commonly known as the Baetican broom, is a shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, pinnate leaves and is adapted to dry, rocky soils. It is often found in open woodlands and scrublands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
